text.0: born in the heavens the dawn hath flushed and showing her majesty is come as law ordaineth.
text.1: she hath uncovered fiends and hateful darkness best of aṅgirases hath waked the pathways.
text.2: rouse us this day to high and happy fortune to great felicity o dawn promote us.
text.3: vouchsafe us manifold and splendid riches famed among mortals manbefriending goddess.
text.4: see lovely mornings everlasting splendours bright with their varied colours have approached us.
text.5: filling the region of midair producing the rites of holy worship they have mounted.
text.6: she yokes her chariot far away and swiftly visits the lands where the five tribes are settled.
text.7: looking upon the works and ways of mortals daughter of heaven the worlds imperial lady.
text.8: she who is rich in spoil the spouse of sūrya wondrously opulent rules all wealth and treasures.
text.9: consumer of our youth the seers extol her lauded by priests rich dawn shines out refulgent.
text.10: apparent are the steeds of varied colour the red steeds carrying resplendent morning.
text.11: on her alllovely car she comes the fair one and brings rich treasure for her faithful servant.
text.12: true with the true and mighty with the mighty with gods a goddess holy with the holy.
text.13: she brake strong fences down and gave the cattle the kine were lowing as they greeted morning.
text.14: o dawn now give us wealth in kine and heroes and horses fraught with manifold enjoyment.
text.15: protect our sacred grass from mans reproaches preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
